TextView.android:text: In rare cases, an allergy can lead to a severe allergic reaction, called anaphylaxis or anaphylactic shock, which can be life-threatening. This affects the whole body and usually develops within minutes of exposure to something you're allergic to. Signs of anaphylaxis include any of the symptoms above, as well as: • swelling of the throat and mouth • difficulty breathing • lightheadedness • confusion • blue skin or lips • collapsing and losing consciousness Anaphylaxis is a medical emergency that requires immediate treatment. Read more about anaphylaxis for information about what to do if it occurs.
